text:
Hi all, I have tried contacting HubSpot support, but they aren't available. I was wondering if someone could help me out with the following issue:
I'm trying to feed our media releases into a blog format, but all of the templates that I've looked at seem to require images. I'm kind of hoping I can push these releases into a list view rather than the block model commonly used for blog posts. Can anyone point me in the right direction?

Hey <@UEYQ0QHT3> there is a setting in the blog settings to either show or not show the feature image in the listing view, so technically all templates should support not having an image if they are coded correctly.

If you are looking for something specifically you're probably going to need to edit the html for the blog listing in the template. But if you're just removing stuff it might not be too tricky to achieve yourself
Okay - so long as I've clone this template, it shouldn't affect any of my other blogs, correct?
yep that's correct and the best way to do it
after you're happy with the preview you can swap to the edited template from the blog content settings

I can see where it has the featured image tag, but I don't know how to remove the space - when I post an article online that doesn't have an image, there's a white gap between the heading and the text
or could I just remove the featured image section altogether?
Hmm, that doesn't seem to be working either - I'm still getting an awkward white space in my articles
Hard to know from here, if there a preview link?
Does this link work for you? <https://app.HubSpot.com/design-previewer/2095495/templates/7724045491>
nope :disappointed:
Okay, here's an old link that's live:
<http://propertycouncil-com-au-2095495.hs-sites.com/news/media-releases/review-of-climate-change-policies>
remove the line <img class="post-header-bg"
that will remove 20px or so
I just tried to remove the featured image section, but now it's shuffled all of the post filters to the bottom of the page
looks like maybe a div hasn't been closed. might be time to get a developer
Agreed - we had a developer build these, but honestly I think I'm just going to delete it and download a free template. There are too many errors to iron out!
yea it's a tricky balance
